name: New NWN patch expands possible multiclasses to 8!!!!!!!
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
- Added support for up to 8 multiclasses, configurable per-module.
Oh, you sweet, sweet game!  So, all you builders, start your engines!  This is gonna get WILD!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, for crying out loud! "I'm getting too old for this shit," springs to mind.

Here's the link to DM Wise's thread giving details of more of the available changes: New Patch.

 So, of the 23 currently available standard/ prestige classes, in theory we'll be able to take more than a third of them in one character? Opportunities and challenges loom ahead, boys and girls. Strap in, this is likely going to be a bumpy ride.

If it takes off big time, we might have to add some new forums to accommodate this. Let's see if there's a clamour for it.

"Never-ending tales" indeed!

Thanks for the heads-up, Web.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I'm drooling over an almost full BAB rdd/pm monster (w/4 attacks/round)!!!!

With Uncanny Dodge to preserve dodge AC!!!

And HiPS!!!!!

Wooooohooooooo!

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
"Added support for up to 8 multiclasses on creatures"

Umm.. that doesnt say that we (PC's) can do that... but it does mean the Boss's could now have 8 classes we have to deal with...

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
It also says this
- Added support for up to 8 multiclasses, configurable per-module.
I assume this is means both Toons and m0bs.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content: I hope your right  :)   Would be real interesting if the WoG Bosses get 5 more classes and we dont....

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I doubt that would make much difference, tbh.

One can basically give a custom creature anything one wants - one just has to do the work.  That includes feats, skills, abilities, BaB, AB, AC, etc.  Having additional classes won't do too much to change that imo.  Just a few abilities/skills are tied directly to classes (or restricted).

PCs, on the other hand...oh boy!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Just to make things clear:
Added support for up to 8 multiclasses - we are talking about 8 classes in a single multiclassed build?
Configurable per module - does that mean that it is up to the module designer? And if so, can it also be restricted to less than 3?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: BTW it is a massive update.  I see they fixed the human multiclass xp bug.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Yes, the excitement is real on this one!

I have asked to clarify about the up to 8 possible classes thing.  But assuming that it will allow up to 8 Classes per Character...hooboy.  Gonna need a mop and bucket for aisle 1, please!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Btw - this patch is beta and has gone live!

I'd grab it immediately, but as I play on a PW...meh.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I have confirmed that this is indeed for PCs!

Oh my stars and garters!  What a time to be alive!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: So, Staggy ol' boy!  What's the poop?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Well, I suppose we'll have to find out which of the changes are DM/ module creator driven, and which are player driven before getting too excited (though your enthusiasm is great to see, btw!). Presumably if the module/ PW doesn't enable the player to effect <8 classes, or chooses to allow only partial implementation, that will have an impact.

From a building perspective, obviously this could open up many more possibilities (assuming racial/ alignment restrictions still apply), but there are many things we'd need to know more about before boldly setting forth - one that immediately leaps to mind is the implication for xp and penalties thereto, because if the current rules still apply a player could end up with a 100% xp penalty.

And I'm guessing that, as taking more classes perforce means fewer levels for the primary class, we'll have to be careful that doesn't end up weakening builds (particularly caster-clerics and arcanists). How useful would a 5/5/5/5/5/5/5/5 build actually be? So we'll need to find some way of making the best of various combos rather than going down a middle-of-the-road answer. There's no point sticking more classes in if their impact is meh, after all. And I suppose we'll only find our way through this by practicing.

Equally, if everything becomes an uber-build (assuming enemy NPCs will also be making use of the changes), things are gonna become pretty stagnant pretty quick.

So it seems to be a hurry up and wait scenario atm. But if you - or anyone else - gives the beta a whirl, please keep us informed of progress.

Cheers

posts.content:

posts.author: Mick Dagger

Stagmeister wrote:
Mar 17, 2023
Well, I suppose we'll have to find out which of the changes are DM/ module creator driven, and which are player driven before getting too excited (though your enthusiasm is great to see, btw!). Presumably if the module/ PW doesn't enable the player to effect <8 classes, or chooses to allow only partial implementation, that will have an impact.

From a building perspective, obviously this could open up many more possibilities (assuming racial/ alignment restrictions still apply), but there are many things we'd need to know more about before boldly setting forth - one that immediately leaps to mind is the implication for xp and penalties thereto, because if the current rules still apply a player could end up with a 100% xp penalty.

And I'm guessing that, as taking more classes perforce means fewer levels for the primary class, we'll have to be careful that doesn't end up weakening builds (particularly caster-clerics and arcanists). How useful would a 5/5/5/5/5/5/5/5 build actually be? So we'll need to find some way of making the best of various combos rather than going down a middle-of-the-road answer. There's no point sticking more classes in if their impact is meh, after all. And I suppose we'll only find our way through this by practicing.

Equally, if everything becomes an uber-build (assuming enemy NPCs will also be making use of the changes), things are gonna become pretty stagnant pretty quick.

So it seems to be a hurry up and wait scenario atm. But if you - or anyone else - gives the beta a whirl, please keep us informed of progress.

Cheers
I'm with Stag here.
The impact on xp penalty must be sorted out. With the current rules you can end up with a negative xp per kill if you have enough non favored base classes.
Builds with front loaded classes may benefit from the change, but not necessarily builds focusing on classes that get better with levels, so there is a balance here somewhere.
As for balance, if this change allows for more powerful builds, it is not far fetched to assume that challenges on PWs and new modules will be tougher too.
That being said, I welcome the opportunity for renewed creativity that these changes spark.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
For those who want to test the Class limits :

https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... node/30774

Just put this in your Override...

The modified version of ruleset.2da is in the override (ovr) folder of the development version game files. The version in base_2da.bif is still the .34 Retail. The line to change appears to be 519 MULTICLASS_LIMIT which defaults to 3.

I wonder whether old school builders like myself can change it to 1. Time will tell.

Due to a Windoze bug (all MyDocument files are set o read only) and because the only solution is to reinstall Windoze (which is massively time consuming and irritating!!), I can't test this!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
So, it works!  Just follow the directions I gave before, edit ruleset.2da - The version in base_2da.bif is still the .34 Retail. The line to change is 519 MULTICLASS_LIMIT which defaults to 3 and set it to desirable Class limit (up to 8) and drop it into your Override.

Done deal.

posts.author: Kamiryn
posts.content:
There's a new CBC available at https://neverwintervault.org/project/nwn1/other/tool/characterbuildcalculator-cbc for some time now. It supports up to 8 classes.

To answer another question: multiclass XP penalty can go up to 140% (= 7 * 20%) making the char actually losing XP when gaining some.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
After some experimenting, I can say that is a bit of a new way of building, you have to always think about the ways to dodge the XP penalty, by using many epic classes and/or human or half/elf races with a good management. 

Is there a special section to post level 40 builds with more than three classes ? I'm testing one of them and I have some backstory ideas.

We're working on it. RL, and Tapatalk having done some despicable things to me at least, have kept me away from full attention. ATM, treat things as usual - things can always be moved once I'm more settled.

Cheers

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content: I encountered a bug when levelling up as RDD as my 5th class. Levelling up does not proceed when I used all skill points I gained at RDD 9. This was solved when I saved 1 skill point and used all skill points on the next level up.
